intro: Aegiphila longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled aegiphila, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Aegiphila longipetiolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
